SALESFORCE HELP
DOCS
VISUALFORCE B2B COMMERCE RELEASE NOTES AND UPGRADE GUIDE
Control How Frequently the Shopping Cart Reprices Items

Gain even more precision over your Shopping Cart page performance by fine-tuning how frequently B2B Commerce for Visualforce calls pricing logic on cart items. No matter which version of the Shopping Cart page you’re using, you can specify how B2B Commerce for Visualforce compares two new fields: the cart’s Repriced Date and the storefront’s Valid Prices Date. A new configuration setting in the Cart module, Optimize Cart Repricing, provides options for how B2B Commerce for Visualforce evaluates these fields. Find the right combination for your storefront, and multiply the improved performance you gain from other Shopping Cart enhancements.

Where: This change applies to B2B Commerce for Visualforce Spring ’19 (version 4.10) in Lightning Experience and Salesforce Classic in Enterprise, Performance, Unlimited, and Developer editions.

Who: This change applies to both version 2.0 and 1.0 of the Shopping Cart page.

Why: In previous versions of B2B Commerce for Visualforce, each time a buyer visited the Shopping Cart page, B2B Commerce called pricing logic to reprice all cart items.

This change improves Shopping Cart page performance by skipping the pricing logic under certain conditions.

How: A new field on the CC Cart object, Repriced Date, specifies the date and time that B2B Commerce for Visualforce most recently priced the cart items. By default, this value is the date and time the cart was created. B2B Commerce updates this value each time it calls pricing logic on the cart items.

A new storefront setting, Valid Prices Date, specifies the date and time that you manually set to signify that the pricing of your products is complete. If your product pricing information changes, the admin is responsible for maintaining this value.

Finally, enter one of the following values for the Optimize Cart Repricing configuration setting on your storefront, and build and activate a new configuration cache:

daily
expired
dailyorexpired
always
